abstracts.cdata!:
The Management Response to the Request
            for Inspection of the Jamuna Bridge Project in Bangladesh
            addresses the concerns that the interests and well-being of
            the char people, people that live on small islands in the
            river, are not being attended to. The disruption of river
            life as a result of bridge construction is noted and the
            Response states that planning for the bridge has been under
            careful consideration and examination and that since
            building is only allowable during the dry season, a phased
            approach was adopted to ensure that the erosion and flooding
            were properly observed.  The resettlement areas, the
            Requesters allege, are too small and do not allow enough
            room for all of the people to be resettled. The Response
            states that the idea for resettlement incentives is in
            effect and that people will be allowed to resettle
            themselves on nearby farmland.  The Management Response
            allows for each allegation to be responded to by the
            Management and the Government of Bangladesh.
